stories.text:
I received an 83(b) form from a company I'm doing work with in exchange for shares. The shares/property were transferred on 1/3/2022. In the 83(b) form they included a restriction as follows:

4. The property is subject to the following restrictions: The company may repurchase at cost all or a portion of the shares upon termination of employment or services of the Taxpayer.

Am I reading this correctly that this is a non-terminating clawback whereas they could basically state at any time that I no longer provide them services and they could force me to sell those shares at cost?
stories.title: 83(b) Company Repurchase Restriction
